question: What element is represented by the periodic table symbol $S$?

Ms. Frizzle wants to demo her "Explosive Gummy Bear" experiment for the school science fair. Her recipe is: $C_{12}H_{22}O_{11}(gummy bears) + O_{2}(g) \rightarrow CO_{2}(g) + H_{2}O(g) + Energy$ To make sure her experiment is a blast, she uses $100. g$ of gummy bears and $50.0 g$ of oxygen gas. How much carbon dioxide gas will be produced upon the completion of her demo?
Ms. Frizzle's demo from problem 2 should be conducted safely because it is highly $\text{_________}$ and $\text{_________}$ a great amount of energy.
How many protons ($p^{+}$), electrons ($e^{-}$), and neutrons ($n^{0}$) does the sulfur ion contain?
Calculate the molarity of a sodium chloride solution that has a density of $1.05 g/mL$ and is made of $10\%$ sodium chloride. (Assume $1 L$ of solution)
The strontium ion would have the same electron configuration as the noble gas $\text{_________}$
What is the molar mass of lithium acetate?
When drawing the Lewis dot structure for the element Nitrogen, we can see that it has $\text{_________}$ lone pair(s) and can form $\text{_________}$ single covalent bond(s).
The $\text{_________}$ of a compound is the simplest whole-number ratio of atoms in a compound.

Back in the classroom, Ms. Frizzle asks her students to name an unknown iron (II) sulfate hydrate ($FeSO_{4} \cdot xH_{2}O$) through experimentation. One group gathers the following data: Mass of hydrate before heating = $6.40 g$; Mass of anhydrous compound after heating = $4.00 g$. What is the name of their unknown hydrate?

Given the following reaction: $80 kcal + A_{2}(g) + 2B_{2}(g) \rightleftharpoons 2AB_{2}(g)$, temperature needs to be $\text{_________}$ and pressure $\text{_________}$ in order to shift the equilibrium point to the right.

The decomposition of hydrogen peroxide, $H_{2}O_{2}$, according to the following UNBALANCED reaction is a $1^{st}$ order reaction: $H_{2}O_{2}(l) \rightarrow H_{2}O(l) + O_{2}(g)$. The solution is originally at $0.600 M$. Find the half-life if after $54$ minutes, only $0.075 M$ of the solution remains.
Sulfuric Acid is a $\text{_________}$ acid.
Octane is the most important part of gasoline... What is the sum of all coefficients when balancing the combustion of octane reaction? $C_{8}H_{18}(l) + O_{2}(g) \rightarrow CO_{2}(g) + H_{2}O(g)$
Which of the following processes is NOT considered a physical change?
Which of the following compounds would you expect to have the lowest $K_{sp}$ value?
The periodic table is arranged in order of increasing $\text{_________}$
Consider the specific heat of water to be $4.18 J/g^{\circ}C$. What would be the heat (in $J$) required to raise the temperature of $250 g$ of water from $20^{\circ}C$ to $80^{\circ}C$?
Which of the following elements is part of the halogen family?
How many moles of phosphate ions are in $4$ moles of sodium phosphate ($Na_{3}PO_{4}$)?
What is the pH of a $0.250M$ solution of $NH_{4}Cl?$ $(Ka=5.6\times10^{-10})$
According to periodic trends, the following element has the highest electronegativity?
When balancing the following reaction, which species has the largest coefficient? When barium chloride and phosphoric acid react, barium phosphate and hydrochloric acid are produced.
The oxidation state of chromium in the chromate ion is $\text{_________}$. When in solution, the ion produces a $\text{_________}$ color.
How many resonance structures does the sulfate ion have?
What type of radiation is seen in the following reaction? $\frac{218}{88}Ra\rightarrow\frac{218}{89}Ac+\frac{0}{-1}e$

Mr. White accidentally discovered an element with the atomic number $120$. His element, $Ww$, would be expected to be part of the $\text{_________}$ group and have $\text{_________}$ valence electrons.

Making ice cream in lab is fun, however, a sodium chloride solution should be made that is $-12^{\circ}C$ or lower for ice cream to form. A student makes a solution by dissolving $100.g$ of $NaCl$ in $500$ grams of water. What will be the freezing point of their solution? Will they be able to use it to make ice cream?
What is the molar mass of the molecular compound of caffeine ($C_{8}H_{10}N_{4}O_{2}$)?
The element $\text{_________}$ is the only metal on Earth that is liquid at room temperature. This metal is so heavy that $2$ tablespoons of it weighs about $1$ pound! Who is this liquid metal?

High temperatures can be dangerous for gases compressed in gas cylinders. A $10.0 L$ container has been designed to hold gases of up to $6.50 atm$. A gas sample is placed in the container with a pressure of $0.850 atm$ at $-20.0^{\circ}C$. At what temperature will the container burst?
What is the percent of chlorine in the compound magnesium chloride?
What element on the periodic table is located in the $4^{th}$ period having $5$ valence electrons?

Mr. White's element was found to have three natural isotopes. $25\%$ of the atoms had a mass of $310$, $38\%$ had a mass of $313$, and the remainder had a mass of $317$. What would be the listed atomic weight of Mr. White's element?
According to $\text{_________}$ electrons will singly fill into orbitals of equal energy until forced to pair up.
Calculate the pOH of a monoprotic strong acid with a $[H^{+}]$ of $5.7\times10^{-1}$ M.
How many grams of $NaOH$ are in $3.25\times10^{23}$ atoms of $NaOH$?
Name the molecular compound $H_{2}O$.
Scientist $\text{_________}$ using the $\text{_________}$ discovered the nucleus.
options: JJ Thomson; Cathode Ray Tube Experiment

question: The following chemical equation can be classified as a $\text{_________}$ reaction. $Cl_{2} + 2NaBr \rightarrow 2NaCl + Br_{2}$
When balancing the following reaction; water would be found on the $\text{_________}$ side and have a coefficient of $\text{_________}$. $Al + OH^{-} \rightarrow AlO_{2}^{-} + H_{2}$ (basic)
What is the name of the compound $Fe_{2}O_{3}$?

Yosemite Sam finds an interesting organic compound out in the desert but wants to know its chemical composition. He uses combustion analysis and burns $1.00 g$ of his mystery compound. He finds it produces $2.10 g$ of $CO_{2}$ and $0.86 g$ of $H_{2}O$. What is the empirical formula of his mystery organic compound?
The molecular compound $CH_{2}O$ has a center atom that is $\text{_________}$ hybridized and has a $\text{_________}$ geometry.
The wavelength emitted when an electron of a hydrogen atom moves from energy level $4$ to energy level $2$ is $\text{_________}$ and this is a form of $\text{_________}$ radiation.

A $0.1M$ Acetic Acid solution is made by a chemistry teacher for a class experiment and is found to have a pH of $2.87$. $HC_{2}H_{3}O_{2}(aq) + H_{2}O(l) \rightleftharpoons H_{3}O^{+}(aq) + C_{2}H_{3}O_{2}^{-}(aq)$. The bio teacher sneakily added a few milliliters of sodium acetate to the solution. How does this affect the chemistry teacher's original solution?
options: there is no change to the solution

question: Which of the following substances has the greatest molar mass?
$2.15g$ of sodium peroxide is combined with water. How much heat is generated? $2Na_{2}O_{2} + 2H_{2}O \rightarrow 4NaOH + O_{2}$ $\Delta H^{\circ} = -215 kJ$
What would be true for a colligative property of water, if the solute sodium chloride is added to it.

Elmer Fudd found a $KOH$ solution in lab, but it was not labeled with its concentration. He decides to neutralize $25.0 mL$ of the base using a $0.5 M$ $HI$ solution. $14.5 mL$ of the acid was used to reach the neutral point. What is the concentration of the unlabeled base?
What would be the resulting net ionic reaction when the following $2$ reactants combine? $Fe(NO_{3})_{3}(aq) + K_{2}S(aq) \rightarrow$
options: No net ionic equation, all substances are soluble.

question: Which of the following elements is not considered a metalloid?
$50.0g$ of calcium bromide are added to a $500. mL$ volumetric flask. Water is then added up to the line. What is the concentration of bromine ions in the solution?
Which of the following pairs correctly represents a conjugate acid-base pair?
Which of the following is not a postulate based on the kinetic-molecular theory?
options: Gases are composed of tiny particles in constant motion.
Gases are separated by huge distances compared to their size.
The molecules of gas display no attraction or repulsion.
The collisions between molecules are completely elastic.
Gases have different average kinetic energies at a given temperature.

question: A $10.0 L$ container at $298K$ holds a mixture of $3$ gases. Helium ($He$) is present at $200 Torr$, Neon ($Ne$) at $300 Torr$, and Argon ($Ar$) at $500 Torr$. What is the mole fraction of Argon in the container?

Marvin the Martian needs to pass chemistry class to go back home, and it all comes down to the accuracy on his stoichiometry lab. Marvin needs to produce $1.87 g$ of product. After running his experiment, he produces $1.650 g$ of product. What is his percent error?
Which of the following statements about catalysts is false?
options: They are substances that speed up the chemical reaction without being permanently altered.
They lower the activation energy of one or more elementary steps in a reaction mechanism
They allow for different reaction pathways to occur.
They do not appear in a chemical reaction.
They are produced in one elementary step and consumed in another elementary step.

question: Hermione is in potions class and needs to make a $500$ mL $KNO_{3}$ aqueous solution with a concentration of $0.250$ M. How many grams of $KNO_{3}$ must she add to water to make this perfect potion?
An atom, $Y$, resides in group 3A. Which ion would most likely be formed by $Y$?
Potassium carbonate has a wide range of uses including as a fertilizer, a flame retardant, and in the production of cocoa powder and juice. What is its molar mass?

In chemistry, entropy helps describe the natural tendency of a reaction or process to move towards greater disorder. Calculate the entropy for the synthesis of magnesium oxide from solid magnesium and oxygen gas. 
 Substance: $Mg(s)$, $S = 32.69$ J/mol K; $O_{2}(g)$, $S = 205.0$ J/mol K; $MgO(s)$, $S = 27.91$ J/mol K.

Harry needs to produce solid chromium for his potions class project. He needs to know how much average current he needs to make $2.08$ g of chromium in his $40$ min class period. He is able to reduce $Cr^{+3}$ to $Cr(s)$ by placing two inert electrodes in a $Cr(NO_{3})_{3}(aq)$ solution in an electrolytic cell. How much current does he need? ($F = 96,500$ C/mol $e^{-}$)
One of cesium's isotopes has a mass number of $137$. How many neutrons would be found in its nucleus?
Epsom Salt has many diverse uses, from helping with pain and inflammation to cleaning tiles and grout. Its chemical name is magnesium sulfate heptahydrate. What is the percent of water in Epsom Salt?
One of the uses of the compound $CaBr_{2}$ is as a sedative in medical applications. What is its chemical name?

Hydrogen peroxide decomposes according to the equation below. How much hydrogen peroxide is left if $5.00$ moles of it is used and we see the production of $2.00$ L of oxygen gas at STP? 
 $2H_{2}O_{2}(aq) \rightarrow 2 H_{2}O(l) + O_{2}(g)$

Professor Snape discovered a strange solid on the Hogwarts grounds. After running various tests, he discovers it has a molar mass of $180.2$ g/mol and a melting point of $423$ K. He fully dissolved it in water and it proved to be a terrible conductor of electricity. His solid is more than likely a compound.

An exothermic reaction occurs when a piece of potassium metal is placed in water: $2K(s) + 2H_{2}O(l) \rightarrow 2KOH(aq) + H_{2}(g)$. What are the signs of $q$ and $w$ for this reaction at constant temperature and pressure?

Consider the following generic gas phase equilibrium reaction: $A_{2}(g) + 3B_{2}(g) \rightleftharpoons 2AB_{3}(g)$. Calculate the equilibrium partial pressure of $B_{2}$ if the equilibrium partial pressure of $AB_{3}$ is $0.50$ atm and $A_{2}$ is $0.15$ atm. ($K_{p} = 107$)
The following qualitative data describes what state of matter? • Particles slide past one another closely • Definite Volume • Indefinite Shape

A student has a graduated cylinder with $20.50$ mL of water. They place a $3.75$ g object that has a density of $2.380$ g/mL in the graduated cylinder and watch it completely sink. What is the final volume of the water in the graduated cylinder?
What nuclear process occurs in the sun?
Fast-forward to the year 2070. One of your grandkids taking chemistry, asks you which atomic orbital is after 6g. What would be your answer?
